content: same in the adjoining space and you will have two smaller groups of stitches which match the size of the 3 treble_crochet continue along the side of the blanket until you come to the corner then it is 3 treble_crochet 3 chain 3tr work all the way round remembering the special stitches in the adjoining spaces when you get back to the beginning corner 3 treble_crochet 3ch and slip_stitch to first ch2 finish off and weave in ends round 2 turn your work to the right side and with colour biscuit attach yarn to any corner space chain 2 counts as 1 treble_crochet 2 treble_crochet in same space 3 treble_crochet in all spaces until the corner 3 treble_crochet 3ch 3tr continue all the way round until you back to the beginning corner 3 treble_crochet 3 chain slip_stitch to first chain 2 finish off round 3 turn your work again an repeat round 2 in colour mint round 4 colour biscuit round 5 colour raspberry round 6 colour biscuit round 7 colour olive round 8 colour biscuit round 9 colour plum remembering to turn the work each time that s the first border complete and now it s on to the simple granny squares border you can use the picture above as a guide for the colours or go ahead and work your own colours to get a balance i ve tried to include the same colours on each side but in different sequences for the square with any colour chain 3 and slip_stitch to form a loop round 1 chain 2 counts as 1 treble_crochet 2 treble_crochet into loop *chain 1 3 treble_crochet into loop repeat from * twice more chain 1 slip_stitch into first chain 2 round 2 chain 2 counts as 1 treble_crochet 2 treble_crochet into space 3 treble_crochet into each space around slip_stitch into first chain 2 round 3 this is the join as you go round so follow the instructions as before i preferred to make up each square and join it as i went along but you can make a batch of squares completed to round 2 you will need 48 and then join them with round 3 and then it s back to row of these gentle granny stripes follow the pattern as before in the following colours and of course remembering to turn your work at each round as well as working the smaller stitches in the adjoining corners of the granny squares 1 silver 2 silver 3 olive 4 olive 5 old gold 6 graphite 7 graphite 8 graphite 9 pistachio and mint carry the yarn of one colour under the stitches of the next colour 10 silver 11 silver 12 silver 13 silver and last but not least the scalloped border you can use all your small leftovers for this border using any colour attach yarn to any corner space 1 double_crochet
